channel.title: PI, How do I stop 1 item from being spawned?
channel.description: Hey everyone on my server there is a bulging taxbag, its all glitched up and I want that, and the empty tax bag not to be spawned by my staff. Can someone tell me where to edit this? or maybe even give me the code for it? Thanks!

item.title: PI, How do I stop 1 item from being spawned?
item.dc:creator: @laakerules laakerules
item.description:
@laakerules wrote:

Okay well if you know java and wanna make it better and cleaner you would make a array of ints. then do a for loop, that way all you do is add an int to the array and then if that item id == the one they want spawned then it wont spawn it by doing a return

item.title: PI, How do I stop 1 item from being spawned?

item.description:

This wont work?

if (command.equals("item")) { if (args.length == 2 || args.length == 3) { int id = Integer.parseInt(args[1]); if (ItemDefinition.forId(id) == 10831 || ItemDefinition.forId(id) == 10831) { player.getActionSender().sendMessage("Removed item by Nick!"); return; } int count = 1; if (args.length == 3) { count = Integer.parseInt(args[2]); } } } if (command.equals("item")) { if (args.length == 2 || args.length == 3) { int id = Integer.parseInt(args[1]); if (ItemDefinition.forId(id) == 10835 || ItemDefinition.forId(id) == 10835) { player.getActionSender().sendMessage("Removed item by Nick! ;)"); return; } int count = 1; if (args.length == 3) { count = Integer.parseInt(args[2]); } } }

item.title: PI, How do I stop 1 item from being spawned?
item.dc:creator: @Sinned Sinned
item.description:
@Sinned wrote:

Make a check in your item command for the item ID.

//NOT THE ACTUAL CODE

if (command.equals("item")) {             
        if (args.length == 2 || args.length == 3) {
                int id = Integer.parseInt(args[1]);
                        if (ItemDefinition.forId(id) == #### || ItemDefinition.forId(id) == ####) {
                                player.getActionSender().sendMessage("You cannot spawn this item.");
                                return;
                        }
                        int count = 1;
                        if (args.length == 3) {
                                count = Integer.parseInt(args[2]);
                        }
                }
        }

Adapt it to your server.

Read full topic
